tables.name: CurrentAccountContract
tables.description:
A Current Account Contract is a contract between a credit institute and customer, which is based on the customer's request for opening a bank account of type current account and consists among others, account holder, general terms and conditions.

Comment: A bank account based on a current account contract is an account that allows money to be held on behalf of the account holder

columns.name: UUID
columns.description: An universal unique identifier of a bank account contract. Example: 01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef

columns.name: ID
columns.description: An identifier of a bank account contract.

columns.name: CurrencyCode
columns.description: A CurrencyCode specifies the currency of the bank account contract. Example: EUR

columns.name: BankAccountIdentifyingElements
columns.description: A BankAccount is a bank account associated with the bank account contract.

columns.name: LifeCycleStatusCode
columns.description: A coded representation of the life cycle status of a bank account contract. Example: 2

columns.name: DormancyStatusCode
columns.description: A coded representation of the dormancy status of a bank account contract. Example: 01

columns.name: UsageNote
columns.description: A comment on the usage of the current account contract.

columns.name: SystemAdministrativeData
columns.description: SystemAdministrativeData is administrative data that is stored in a system. This data includes change dates and change times.

columns.name: AccountHolderPartyIdentifyingElements
columns.description: A party which legally holds a Bank Account associated with the bank account contract.

columns.name: Product
columns.description: A Product describes the (financial) product upon which the bank account contract is based.

columns.name: BusinessEventRecord
columns.description: A record of a business event that changes a bank account contract.

columns.name: OperationalBankContractManagement
columns.description: An OperationalBankContractManagement is responsible for managing operational bank contracts and executing the related banking processes.

columns.name: BusinessProcessChainAssignment
columns.description: Business Process Chain Assignment is the assignment of a business object node to a business process chain.

columns.name: ChangeStateID
columns.description: A ChangeStateID is a unique identifier for a change state. Example: 20191122135035.7818490

columns.name: CreateDraftRequestedIndicator
columns.description: Indicates whether the current account contract shall be created with life cycle status code 'Draft Entered'.

tables.name: BankAccount
tables.description:
A Bank Account is an account that holds funds in a bank and is subject to deposits and withdrawals.Remark: 
 Filter: Only 'Eq' is supported as logical operator. 
 Integrity Conditions: 
 The following combinations of properties for filtering are allowed: 
 a.) by Bank Account ID 
 - ID (mandatory) 
 - CurrencyCode (optional) 
 - BankRoutingID (optional) 
 - BankCountryCode (optional) 
 No other filter attributes are allowed. 
 b.) by Bank Account Standard ID 
 - StandardID (mandatory) 
 - CurrencyCode (optional) 
 c.) by BankAccountContractUUID 
 - BankAccountContractUUID (mandatory) 
 d.) by Bank Account Contract ID 
 - BankAccountContractID (mandatory)

columns.name: UUID
columns.description: A UUID is a universal unique identifier of a bank account. Example: 01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef
